results.title: The Cat who drank and used too much
results.creator_credit: Timothy Armstrong, Yvonne Parsons, Randall Frederick and FMS Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring Pat the Cat, this rather clever film produced by the US Alcohol and Drug Foundation focuses on the damage caused by excess drinking and the availability of help and support through the Recovery Center. Pat the Cat starts drinking to excess, tries other substances, ignores his friends’ advice, crashes his car and is finally referred for recovery. Narrated by Julie Harris.

results.title: The Cat returns = Neko no ongaeshi
results.creator_credit: Hiroyuki Morita, Nozomu Takahashi, Toshio Suzuki and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Animated fantasy adventure about a young high school girl, Haru, who finds herself being rewarded for a good deed carried out as a child. She simply feeds a hungry kitten but when this unique kitten grows, it is decided in the cat kingdom that Haru is special and should be given gifts. Daughter of a single mother, the young girl has the usual teenage angst and wants to impress the handsome boy in her class. Her usual routine is forgotten however as she is transported to the Kingdom of Cats. Haru also unwittingly finds herself engaged to the Prince of Cats! A coming-of-age film with a difference as this is a magical and fantastic adventure suitable for family viewing. From the creators of award winning “Spirited Away” [318123] the moving classical soundtrack adds to the enchanting nature of the story.

results.title: The Cat in the hat
results.brief_description: Impulsive and imaginative, the Cat romps through the house dispelling boredom for a brother and sister on a rainy day, while their mother is away. Invites children to become self-sufficient in their use of time. Adapted from the book by Dr. Seuss.

results.title: The Cat family
results.brief_description: Shows how a number of animals may differ in size, colour and habitat, yet possess common characteristics. Studies the domestic cat and includes scenes of the larger cats, including the tiger, lynx and leopard. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Cat came back (K)
results.creator_credit: Cordell Barker, Ches Yetman, Richard Condie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cordell Barker’s animated film is based on a century old folk song. Poor old Mr Johnson becomes increasingly manic as he tries and tries again to rid himself of a little yellow cat. His desperate attempts to find solitude become an obsession, with tragic consequences. Winner of the Special Jury Prize for Humor and Music at the 1988 World Festival of Animation in Zagreb. Fourteen awards, including Chicago; Shanghai; Quebec; Genie, Toronto; Oscar nomination.

results.title: The Cat came back
results.creator_credit: Cordell Barker, Richard Condie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This hilarious animated short is based on the century-old folk song of the same name. Old Mr. Johnson makes increasingly manic attempts to rid himself of a little yellow cat that just won’t stay away.

results.title: The Cat and the fiddler
results.creator_credit: Jane Startz, Jeffrey Hayes, ACI Films and Thomas Sand Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a travelling fiddler and his dancing cat whose performances earns a living for both of them. The king tries to buy the cat, however it will only dance for the fiddler. He plays but the court and the king cannot stop dancing. Based on the book by Jacky Jeter, illustrated by Lionel kalish. The original illustrations from the book are used in the film. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat and the collector
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A film which tells a story with drawings of how an old man befriends a stray cat and learns about the nature of cats. Based on the book of the same title written and illustrated by Linda Slovach. Narrated by Emery Battis. Suitable for primary school level.
